jp_name: 危険爆弾  Kiken bakudan
function: The Danger Bomb detonates after a set fuse time when thrown or upon being remotely triggered. The explosion is capable of destroying entire celestial entities the size of Earth as well as smaller meteors. The bomb itself is small, as it can be held in human hands.
appears_in: A Visitor from the Country of the Future

jp_name: Doraemon
function: Chapter 132: Bad Luck Diamond is a part of the 8th volume of the Doraemon manga.
appears_in: Category:The Complete Works of Fujiko F. Fujio Chapters
Category:The Complete Works of Fujiko F. Fujio Chapters

jp_name: デビルカード Debiru Kādo
function:
By using this gadget one can gain money by signing a deal with the devil which lives in it. After the deal is done, when someone shakes the card, 300 yens fell from it every time. For every three hundred yens taken out from the card, the one who dealt will get shorter by one millimeter in height.
If too much money is taken out from the card, the dealer might turn shorter like an ant or possibly disappear at 12AM.

jp_name: どくさいスイッチ
function:
In the future lived a powerful dictator who ruled the whole world. The dictator's power was used to control the citizens by ordering them to follow the same ideology. Anyone who opposed or obstructed the dictator were erased off the face of the earth with the switch. In this way, the whole world would go according to the way that the dictator wants it to be. In the scene before the last scene of the episode "The Dictator Switch", Doraemon reveals that this gadget was not created for dictators, but was rather created to teach people a lesson that becoming a dictator is bad.
The switch is capable of removing whatever subjects from existence at the user's demand (including their traces of existence and relevant memories), and the effect can be undone by pressing it again.
Doraemon cannot be despawned by the Dictator Switch and is immune to all of its effects.
appears_in: Doraemon Wii: Secret Tool King Tournament

jp_name: ゴルゴンの首 Gorugon no Kubi
function:
When the box is opened, the user will slowly turn into stone. But if the user pulls the snake on top of the box, the user will turn back to normal. In truth, it is actually a stone-made head with a terrifying design that can emit a type of light from its eyes to turn their target to stone. Pulling the snake which is its hair returns the petrified to normal.
In the 2013 movie, it introduces the DX version of it which is very large in size and can levitate above the ground. Unlike the one introduced in the manga and anime, that version's resetting effect only seems to work if the user yanks one of the snakes while it is facing the petrified subject. The gang defeated it with Shizuka taking over and using a mirror to reflect its petrifying rays back to it. Apparently, the snakes are invulnerable from turning to stone by the rays.

jp_name: 怪談ランプ Kaidan Ranpu
function: Horror Story Lamp creates the surrounding scenery with various sound effects and even environmental changes like a shifting wind of sudden blow-out of the candle. For example, Nobita tells the story similar to Gian's (the Okiku's Plate,番町皿屋敷, lit. The Dish Mansion at Banchō), they heard a sound of a broken plate outside of the room. The cause of that sound was later revealed to be caused by a thief, whom was also counting the money he looted, similar to the scene when the ghost of Okiku was counting (plates).

jp_name: おとりロボット Otori Robotto
function:
Simply place it in the ground and they will lure out the predator from its prey. They are capable of saying Wasshoi (ワッショイ！) while functioning, which the word is commonly shouted during festivals.
In the movie Nobita and the Island of Miracles ~Animal Adventure~, it introduces the more upgraded version, the Decoy Robot DX (おとりロボットＤＸ Otori Robotto Derakkusu) which the gadget has a set of three robots instead of just only one.
appears_in: Nobita and the Island of Miracles ~Animal Adventure~

jp_name: 変形(へんけい)ライト Henkei raito
function:
The gadget has the ability to change the shape of an object to quadrilateral, in particular, squares and rectangles.
Doraemon uses the flashlight to change the shape of Nobita and Tamako's glasses to square. But in the next scene where she prepares dinner, their glasses were reverted back to round.

jp_name: 配達ラケット Haitatsu Raketto
function: Doraemon demonstrating the gadgetThe user must say first the destination of the specific object. Then he/she hits the object to its destination. The gadget can hit anything no matter of its size.

jp_name: デラックスライト/ゴージャスライト
function:
In 1979 animeWhen the light is shined on a regular object, it becomes a "deluxe" object (an example is a regular desk chair turned into an executive chair), to make the object regular again, the user must have the light shined on it again.
Mrs.Goda's outfit transformed into royal gownIn the 1979 episode, the gadget is used to transform Gian's house into an elegant manor as Gian doesn't want Jaiko to embarrass her foreign friend. At the end of the episode, Nobita accidentally transforms Mrs. Goda's cloth into an elegant royal gown.
In the 2005 remake, the following become deluxified:

jp_name: ＤＸ列車セット Derakkusu Ressha Setto
function:
Deluxe Train Set  (ＤＸ列車セット) is a gadget that can make a house into a train.
Put this gadget into the house. The house will be a train and can move anywhere by following the railroad.
appears_in: Nobita Express and the Mystery of the Train Hunter

jp_name: 半分こ刀
function: It allows the user to divide anything into two or more pieces by cutting it with the sword. For example, if you cut a television in half the one television will become two televisions that are noticeably smaller.

jp_name: お医者さんカバン Oishasankaban
function: A bag with a sensor which attaches to a patient and can diagnose any illness they may have. It can also dispense the medicine needed to cure their illness.
appears_in: Doraemon: Nobita and the New Steel Troops ~Winged Angels~
Nobita and the Kingdom of Clouds

jp_name: 母親 HahaoyaGeneral informationCasual informationRelationshipsOther Details
function:
Doraemon's Mom is an unnamed minor character that appeared in But Doraemon Wants a Mom. She is a pink owl-like mechanical caretaker stored in the Substitute Mother Egg.
After Nobita doesn't do what his mother told him to do, Doraemon takes out the Substitute Mother Egg, which would recognize the first living thing it observes as its children. Nobita tricks Doraemon and escapes right before she hatches, causing him to be registered instead. Doraemon doesn't like her caring personality at first, having never experiences the presence of a mother due to his manufacture origins. But later he sees a mother and child walking home, which makes him sad. When Doraemon comes home, he sees his mother cooked him Dorayaki, which he then eats and praises, despite her terrible cooking skills. He was dismayed at her departure.
She has ideal qualities for a mother, but is also over-emotional and isn't good at cooking either. She doesn't like her "children" misbehaving.

jp_name: ドラキュラセット Dorakyura Setto
function:
To use it, the user must put on the fangs and cape, allow the user to transform into a small vampire bat. The user, in bat form, then bites the target neck and wipe the memory with only the chosen memory being wiped and the bite will leave no mark. Other functions of this gadget include flight and open the locked window.
Apparently, despite the appearance as a kid's toy set, this gadget may be used in spying and infiltration.

jp_name: ユメかんとくいす Yume Kantoku Isu
function: It allows a person to control or 'direct' another person's dream.

jp_name: 夢はしご Yume hashigo
function:
The user can use this gadget to go to anyone else's dream as they want.
As revealed in The Doraemons Special manga the user, after entering the dream world, can't escape back to the real world after The Nightmare Eater Baku appeared. The same user can't even go to another person's dream unless Baku escaped to the real world and was captured.

jp_name: 夢はしご Yume Hashigo
function: It's used for making the user move into someone's dream.

jp_name: ユメテレビ
function:
As a TV gadget, it shows other people's dreams. Changing the channel changes the direction and distance the TV scans for, allowing you to see anyone's dreams.
If the monitor of the gadget is destroyed, this will allow the enemy of anyone's dreams you watched to pop up to the real world and cause havoc. However, this has not happened.

jp_name: ゆめふうりん
function:
The Dream Bell can only be used on sleeping people (to some extent, those who are unconscious or half-asleep or in a trance are excluded).
The user may call a person's name while ringing the Dream Bell. They will rise and sleepwalk (somnambulism) towards the Dream Bell's user. Although rather slow, they may perform various physical activities like playing soccer and jumping rope. Even though the person is practically still sleeping, their personality is still similar as they are awake. A person summoned by the Dream Bell doesn't seem to be able to speak properly, as sleep talking is always an unclear speech (often in a form of mumble).
appears_in: Nobita and the Knights of Dinosaurs
Gian Makes an Appearance on TV
We're Gonna Go Flower Watching, No Matter What

jp_name: ゆうれいの干物 Yūrei no himono
function: It is used to scare someone. This gadget can be used when exposed to water. Once you pour water on it, it will expand.

jp_name: ドライ・ライト Dorai Raito
function: It is used as the source of energy that is commonly used in the 22nd century.

jp_name: フエルミラー Fuerumira
function:
Duplicate Mirror is one of a Doraemon gadgets.
You can duplicate whatever things you want it by showing it into the mirror, except for money. Because it is a mirror, the results will be reversed and it won't be able to be used. But be careful!, if you forget to turn off this gadget, something bad Will happen. Just like Nobita, he was forced into the world of a mirror by mirror Nobita himself.
